abstract: Exxon Mobil replaced 100 percent of 2009 oil production with new reserves, but the oil will be harder to extract and of lower value to investors.
snippet: Exxon Mobil replaced 100 percent of 2009 oil production with new reserves, but the oil will be harder to extract and of lower value to investors.
lead_paragraph: With oil majors given the cold shoulder in many developing countries, it is no mean feat that Exxon Mobil managed to replace 100 percent of last year’s production with new reserves. Even so, not all energy is equal. The stuff Exxon is using to fill its pipeline will be harder to extract and of lower value to investors.

headline.main: Barrels in Reserve but Harder to Get
headline.print_headline: Barrels in Reserve But Harder to Get

byline.original: By Christopher Swann and Martin Hutchinson
